bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Birmingham was a group of clergymen who met regularly for mutual fellowship. At the meetings, the members heard papers read and held discussions on a variety of topics. The Association disbanded in 1971.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Presbyterian Ministers' Association of Birmingham, Alabama. Minutes discuss routine business and record speakers and the topics of their addresses. Earlier minutes include brief summaries of talks. Volumes also include lists of members, treasurer's reports, newspaper clippings, programs, and responses to a 1970 survey of members on the future of the Association. Some of the minutes discuss racial relations, including proposals in 1963 to open membership of the Association to ministers of "members of any other race."
